parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to a specific candidate's official campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post quotes Bishop László Böcskei of Nagyvárad, urging the Hungarian community to vote. While it doesn't explicitly name a candidate, it strongly implies support for candidates representing the interests of the Hungarian community in Romania.  This indirectly refers to candidates from UDMR (Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România), given the context and the advertiser's identity ("RMDSZ Bihar Megye," the Hungarian name for UDMR Bihor County).  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - a could potentially apply.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  The message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience within the Hungarian community in Bihor County, Romania.  Therefore, it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voting within the Hungarian community.  The message implies that not voting would be detrimental to their interests. This strongly suggests an electoral objective to increase voter turnout among a specific group likely to support UDMR candidates.  Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post is not journalistic in nature. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. It's a clear call to action, urging a specific community to vote, which is not a characteristic of journalistic work.  It does not provide news, analysis, or opinion pieces on political events in an unbiased manner.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post presents Bishop Böcskei's statement, not a personal opinion of the advertiser. However, the act of promoting this statement, especially given the timing and context, is clearly intended to influence the vote.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>8674690519266687</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning a specific candidate, strongly encourages voting within the Hungarian community in Bihor County. Given the advertiser is RMDSZ Bihar Megye (UDMR Bihor County), this implicitly promotes UDMR candidates. The paid Facebook advertisement targets a wide audience and aims to influence voter turnout, fulfilling the criteria for electoral propaganda under Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The timing of the post, after the official campaign period, is a crucial factor.  While the post itself might not directly violate Article 98 t) if the campaign period was still ongoing, the context and the implicit endorsement of UDMR candidates raise serious concerns.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>UDMR Candidates (Bihor County)</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ Bihar Megye, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin promovarea pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unui mesaj care îndeamnă comunitatea maghiară din județul Bihor la vot, fără a menționa candidați specifici, dar implicit susținând candidații UDMR, având un efect electoral clar de creștere a participării la vot în rândul unui electorat favorabil UDMR.  Mesajul, preluat de la episcopul László Böcskei, este prezentat într-un context electoral și are ca scop influențarea votului, îndeplinind criteriile de propagandă electorală conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. ID-ul postării pe Facebook este 8674690519266687.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
